What's SYLOE?

SYLOE is a stat used to evaluate punting performance more accurately than yards/attempt currently does. It looks at the field position that the offense starts from following a punt and assigns the yardage over/under expected to the punter. 1/4

#nflverse https://t.co/I2BIcMTFSj

Not sure if this will help anyone, but here's a quick-and-dirty way to get a list of every unique player's gsis id, name, and first team using #nflverse data. I find it helpful for labeling/adding colors to plots.

(Also, switch filter to teamnum == max(teamnum) for last team) https://t.co/cwlabe3g4W

@tejfbanalytics @NFLFootballOps @DougKyed @JHamptAnalytics According to #nflverse, there is around an 15% chance that a team starts on their own 25 and scores a TD followed up by a successful 2 point conversion.

31.4% probability of a TD followed up by a 47.35% probability for 2 points.

S3 methods are an awesome addition to your toolbox as an #rstats package developer! Here are a few neat examples from some #nflverse projects for prettier printing, summarising, and autoplotting: https://t.co/Z2WcXI1mMN

Important #nflverse updates: we've reorganized the data automation to push into releases of a single repo (nflverse-data), and will deprecate (ie stop updating) the previous repos. 

We recommend all #rstats users update to nflreadr 1.2.0+ which is now available on ✨CRAN ✨ https://t.co/fcPEVswbMr

- GitHub Releases for being an awesome resource
- @cboettig for his work on the {piggyback} package that makes working with Releases so darn easy
- @mrcaseb for his support and feedback 
- the #nflverse community for being fantastic and a huge inspiration
